# Arpeggio: sus2 in G

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is when the notes of a chord are played individually rather than simultaneously. In this case, we have a sus2 arpeggio in the key of G. The sus2 chord is built with the root, second, and fifth notes of the major scale. The sus2 in G consists of the notes G, A, and D.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (root)
- A (second)
- D (fifth)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The sus2 arpeggio has a dreamy and ethereal quality to it, as the second interval creates tension and a sense of floating. It can be used to evoke a sense of introspection, longing, or mystery in music. This arpeggio is often found in genres like folk, pop, and ambient music where a relaxed and contemplative atmosphere is desired.

## Songs
1. "**Don't Know Why**" by Norah Jones - This song features a sus2 arpeggio in G throughout the intro and verses, creating a laid-back and mellow vibe.
2. "**I Will Follow You into the Dark**" by Death Cab for Cutie - The song uses a sus2 arpeggio in G in the chorus, adding a gentle and melancholic touch to the melody.
3. "**Lua**" by Bright Eyes - This track incorporates a sus2 arpeggio in G, enhancing the somber and reflective mood of the song.
